title: Is music copyrighted or copywritten? - Quora

response.answer_text: Copyrighted. Copyright is a body of rights that creators have over material they create. The most basic of these is the right to make copies: hence, “copyright”. A copy writer is someone who “writes copy”, ‘copy’ being a term in the advertising and magazine trade for text written to fill a customer’s requirements. There is no such word in English as copywritten. The closest you would get is “copy written” — such as, “We need to send out that ad by five o’clock. Did you get the copy written for it yet?”

Righted, no matter how odd this looks. The word is copy+right. That is the license from the government which gives an author the right to make and sell copies of his work while other may not do so. Because most people first encounter the word copyright in a book, they sometimes confuse right with the homophone write. There is no word copywrite. There are the words copyright, copyrights, and copyrighted.
